revised_title: Exploring Transplantation Antigen Extracts in Syrian Hamsters
tldr: The study investigates the properties of transplantation antigen extracts in Syrian hamsters, using a polyoma virus-induced tumor as a source of cells. The researchers found that the extracted antigen elicited direct hypersensitivity reactions in specifically presensitized MHA hamsters but was incapable of inciting transplantation immunity in normal MHA hosts. However, when emulsified in complete Freund's adjuvant, the material was immunogenic, leading to accelerated rejection of subsequent test tumor or skin homografts. The study also explored the effects of chronic treatment with antigenic material on MHA hamsters, inducing a high degree of tolerance in respect of subsequent homografts of CB skin.
